Milt,
With the hawk count shut down due to rainy weather I'm catching up on=
 things post-shinsa.

The fittings shinsa team this time around took quite =
a lot of time scratching our heads to come up with informative attributions=
 on the mumei stuff.  There were quite a few attributions to schools and gr=
oups.  The problem simply is that for many pieces there is nothing distinct=
ive enough about the workmanship or quality to go beyond just Kyo, Edo or M=
ito Kinko.  Throwing out something more specific isn't going to help anyone=
 learn if there are multiple other groups turning out work of the same styl=
e.

Honestly I found my self thinking several times "why would someone subm=
it this item to shinsa?"  You want to give the customer his money's worth, =
but there's very little that can be said about the piece.  It's kind of lik=
e being handed a T-shirt and being asked which fashion design house it came=
 from.

Jim

  A suggestion if I may............. how about the shinsa team be =
a

r

  Milt=
